definitions.definition: Form created in the mind, rather than the forms perceived through the five senses; an instance of thinking.
definitions.example: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.

definitions.definition: The operation by which such forms arise or are manipulated; the process of thinking; the agency by which thinking is accomplished.
definitions.example: Without freedom of thought there can be no such thing as wisdom, and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.

definitions.definition: A way of thinking (associated with a group, nation or region).
definitions.example: Traditional eastern thought differs markedly from that of the west.
